text: John Walter Branthwaite (1 December 1927 – 30 January 2014) was a New Zealand Anglican priest in the second half of the Twentieth century; and the first two decades of the 21st.Memory Tree He was educated at the University of New Zealand and ordained in 1952.Crockford's Clerical Directory 1980/60 p 121: Oxford, OUP, 1983 After a curacy in Invercargill he held incumbencies at Waitaki, Wakatipu, Opawa and Otipua. He was Archdeacon of Timaru from 1975 to 1977 when he was appointed Archdeacon of Akaroa. He died on 30 January 2014.Anglican Life: Bishop Victoria's Newsletter ==References== Category:University of New Zealand alumni Category:Archdeacons of Timaru Category:Archdeacons of Akaroa Category:2014 deaths Category:1927 births
title: John Branthwaite
